page.title: 03 Weaverthorpe Farming
page.content: The main crop is{corn:}barley and wheat.{Potatoes,}oil-seed rape, swedes,{sugar-beet}and peas (for freezing) are also grown. {Intensive farming}with a very small labour force is made possible by the extensive use of{modern machinery,} much of it being{highly specialised:} {tractors,}various types of cultivators and harrows,{combine-harvesters,} elevators, grass-cutters, balers, potato planters and harvesters, beet harvesters, sprayers,fertiliser and muck (manure) spreaders and hedge cutters. Since the introduction of combines etc., many hedges have been removed to create larger fields. Animal farming is mainly{bullock} fattening and{sheep}breeding.{Pig} farming is the newest development. Aeroplane and helicopter spraying is much used, mostly for fungi-cides.
